data.title: Playoff Information
data.content:
At the end of the regular season, the top three teams from the West region and top two teams from the East region will directly qualify into the playoffs.

A play-in tournament for each region will qualify an additional three teams—two from the West and one from the East—into the remaining spots in the eight-team double-elimination playoff bracket.

More information about the postseason format will be shared later.

data.title: LEGEND
data.content:
PTS - The amount of League Points each team has earned. Teams earn 1 League Point per match win and bonus points for tournament placement. Read more about league points here.
RGN - Online Play Region
L - Matches lost
MAP W-L-T - Map record (win-loss-tie)
W - Matches won
MP - Matches Played
DIFF - Map differential (wins minus losses)

data.title: TIE-BREAKING
data.content:
League points in qualifying matches will be used to determine initial standing, followed by the below tiebreakers.
  1. Tournament Cycle Tiebreakers
    1. Map Differential in qualifying matches
    2. Head-to-Head record in qualifying matches
    3. Strength of schedule evaluated by adding opponents’ league points in qualifying matches
    4. Strength of schedule evaluated by adding opponents’ map differentials in qualifying matches
    5. If a tie between two or more teams remains, the tiebreakers in the section below will be applied
  2. Postseason Tiebreakers
    1. Overall Regular Season wins
    2. Overall Regular Season map differential
    3. Head-to-head regular season match differential
    4. Head-to-head regular season map differential
    5. Head-to-head regular season match differential against shared opponents
    6. Head-to-head regular season map differential against shared opponents
    7. If a tie remains after all tiebreakers have been exhausted, a tie breaker match will be played.
